org.rdkit.knime.util

Class WarningConsolidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.WarningConsolidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RDKitInternals<WarningConsolidator>

    public class WarningConsolidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements RDKitInternals<WarningConsolidator>
    This class gathers warnings from different situations and produces on request a summary warning message taking into account how often a warning occurred and in what context it occurred. It is also capable of merging multiple warning consolidator objects together and generating one summary as well. A context can be a row, a batch, a list of images, etc. When warnings are saved, they can be assigned to such an context (specified only as contextId later on). The warning consolidator then tracks how often a warning occurred within a context.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

        public WarningConsolidator(WarningConsolidator.Context... contexts)
        Creates a new warning consolidator with the specified contexts.
        Parameters:
        contexts - Arbitrary list of contexts that will be used for registering warnings in the future.

      • WarningConsolidator

        public WarningConsolidator(WarningConsolidator... consolidators)
        Creates a new warning consolidator based on existing warning consolidators. All warnings and contexts will be merged together into the new one. Later added warnings in the passed in warning consolidators will not be considered anymore.
        Parameters:
        consolidators - Arbitrary list of warning consolidators.

    • Method Detail

      • registerContext

        public void registerContext(WarningConsolidator.Context context)
        Registers the specified context. A context can be a row, a batch, an list of images, etc. When warnings are saved later they can be assigned to such an context (specified only as contextId later on). The warning consolidator then tracks how often a warning occurred within a context. If a context with the same contextId was already registered, it will override it.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of future warnings.

      • getContexts

        public WarningConsolidator.Context[] getContexts()
        Returns all registered contexts.
        Returns:
        Array of contexts. Never null, but maybe empty.

      • getContext

        public WarningConsolidator.Context getContext(java.lang.String contextId)
        Determines the registered context for the specified contextId.
        Parameters:
        contextId - Context Id of interest.
        Returns:
        Context or null, if not registered.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Deletes all warning messages.

      • saveWarning

        public void saveWarning(java.lang.String warning)
        Saves a warning message for later summarizing all of them into a single warning message. This warning will be stored without a context and will not track occurrences.
        Parameters:
        warning - Warning message to save. Can be null to do nothing.

      • saveWarning

        public void saveWarning(java.lang.String contextId,
                        java.lang.String warning)
        Saves a warning message for later summarizing all of them into a single warning message. It will remember how often a certain warning message occurred.
        Parameters:
        contextId - Context of the warning. Can be null, if warning does not belong to any context.
        warning - Warning message to save. Can be null to do nothing.

      • saveWarnings

        public void saveWarnings(WarningConsolidator anotherConsolidator)
        Saves all warning messages from the passed in consolidator. Also, takes over all contexts of the passed in consolidator as well.
        Parameters:
        consolidator - Warning consolidator. Can be null to do nothing.

      • getWarnings

        public java.lang.String getWarnings(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> mapContextOccurrences)
        Generates a string that contains all warning messages that occurred during the factoring process.
        Parameters:
        mapContextOccurrences - Maps context ids to number of occurrences (e.g. number of rows). Can be null.
        Returns:
        Warnings or null, if no warnings occurred.

      • getWarnings

        public java.lang.String getWarnings(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> mapContextOccurrences,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> listSuppressWarnings,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> listSuppressContexts)
        Generates a string that contains warning messages that occurred during the factoring process, but gives additionally the option to suppress certain warnings, if they are matching search criteria specified in the second and third parameter.
        Parameters:
        mapContextOccurrences - Maps context ids to number of occurrences (e.g. number of rows). Can be null.
        listSuppressWarnings - List of search strings. Every warning will be checked before consolidation, if it contains a search string that is part of the list. Can be null. Every search string in the list can start with either "FULL:" (default when nothing is specified), "REGEX:" or "SUB:", which influences the search and matching behavior. If "FULL:" (or nothing) is used the search string must match the entire warning string. If "REGEX:" is used Search strings will be interpreted as regular expression and succeeds if the result is not empty. If "SUB:" is used the search string is interpreted as substring.
        listSuppressContexts - List of context ids to be suppressed. Can be null. Only warnings that don't belong to the specified context will be returned. To address warnings without a context use NO_CONTEXT.getId().
        Returns:
        Warnings or null, if no (non-suppressed) warnings occurred.

      • shouldWarningBeIncluded

        protected boolean shouldWarningBeIncluded(java.lang.String warning,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> listSuppressWarnings)
        Determines for the specific warning, if it should be included in the warning consolidation, or if it should be suppressed based on the second parameter.
        Parameters:
        warning - Warning to check. Must not be null.
        listSuppressWarnings - List of search strings. The warning will be checked, if it contains a search string that is part of the list. Can be null. Every search string in the list can start with either "FULL:" (default when nothing is specified), "REGEX:" or "SUB:", which influences the search and matching behavior. If "FULL:" (or nothing) is used the search string must match the entire warning string. If "REGEX:" is used Search strings will be interpreted as regular expression and succeeds if the result is not empty. If "SUB:" is used the search string is interpreted as substring.
        Returns:
        True, if warning shall be included. False, if it should be suppressed.

      • load

        public void load(Config settings)
        Loads internal content from a KNIME setting object and restores the state of the internal object fully.
        Specified by:
        load in interface RDKitInternals<WarningConsolidator>
        Parameters:
        settings - Settings to read internal content from. Can be null to do reset the internal content without restoring it.

      • save

        public void save(Config settings)
        Saves the full state of internal content into a KNIME setting object. Calling load(Config) with the setting object will restore the full state.
        Specified by:
        save in interface RDKitInternals<WarningConsolidator>
        Parameters:
        settings - Settings to store the internal content into. Can be null to do nothing.

      • merge

        public WarningConsolidator merge(java.util.List<WarningConsolidator> internals)
        Description copied from interface: RDKitInternals
        Merges multiple instances of an internals object together. It can be assumed that the passed in objects are all of exactly the same class. The instance on which merge is called will not be part of the merging process.
        Specified by:
        merge in interface RDKitInternals<WarningConsolidator>
        Parameters:
        internals - Internals to be merged together. Can be null or empty to return null.
        Returns:
        The merged version of all passed in objects or the object itself, if nothing was passed in for merging.
